description: The Pharmacy/Treatment Route segment contains the alternative combination of route, site, administration device, and administration method that are prescribed. The pharmacy, treatment staff and/or nursing staff has a choice between the routes based on either their professional judgment or administration instructions provided by the physician.

1.name: Route
1.description: This field is the route of administration.

2.name: Site
2.description: This field contains the site of the administration route. Refer to HL7table 0163 - Administrative site for valid values.

3.name: Administration Device
3.description: This field contains the mechanical device used to aid in the administration of the drug or other treatment. Common examples are IV-sets of different types. Refer to HL7 table 0164 - Administration device for valid entries.

4.name: Administration Method
4.description: This field identifies the specific method requested for the administration of the drug or treatment to the patient. Refer to HL7table 0165 - Administration method for valid values.

5.name: Routing Instruction
5.description: This field provides instruction on administration routing, especially in cases where more than one route of administration is possible. A typical case would be designating which IV line should be used when more than one IV line is a possible route for injection.
